column4: the computer you're typing commands at is the local computer, and the other is the remote computer.  it doesn't matter if they're sitting on the same desk or on opposite sides of the world
I meant using Nautilus to share files, scp seems easier
does nautilus still have "connect to server" in the file menu?  (it does in 10.04 LTS, but idk about current)

i don't know if nautilus after ubuntu 10.04 has it or not, but try nautilus -> file -> connect to server -> fill in ssh connection options.  nautilus should let you use the remote file system like any folder and use ssh/scp in the background to do what you want
